## Course Objectives

This course gives you an opportunity to produce the first version of your thesis in the field of geoinformatics based on the research project you are carrying out at UNAL in the last years. 

This is a process-oriented writing course that integrates reading, research, writing, and oral presentations. 

---

background-image: url(images/writing_skills.PNG)
background-size: 800px
background-position: 50% 90%

## Course Objectives (cont...)

You will present a manuscript with your thesis results  to an evaluator. 

Your writing output is expected to conform to appropriate standards of scholarship. 

You will engage in class activities to improve your  reading, research, writing, and presentation skills.

# Course Overview

# How this class will work
========================================================

- A substantial progress  on your master research project is necessary

- Class attendance is mandatory 
  - *Presencial* mode: from 03.02 to 26.06
  
- Extra-class work is a must

- Class will be _very_ cumulative

---

# Mechanics
========================================================
- A  weekly lecture: 
  - First part: concepts, methods, examples
  - Second part: student presentations &   writing practicals
